alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 22 at 7:25PM AKST until December 24 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM AKST SUNDAY FOR TURNAGAIN PASS... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected and blizzard-like conditions. Total snow accumulations up to 20 inches in Turnagain Pass. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph in combination with heavy snow will will reduce visibility due to falling and blowing snow. * WHERE...Turnagain Pass * WHEN...Until 3 AM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Rain on snow covered roadways will create slushy and icy conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels along the Seward highway tonight will remain between sea level and approximately 600 ft, with the higher snow levels near Seward. Snow levels will then rise to 800 to 1200 ft through the day Saturday. Rain falling on recent snow will create hazardous travel conditions. Snow accumulations from Seward north to Summit Lake will be highly dependent on the transition to rain. Accumulations of 8-12 inches are possible from Moose Pass north to Summit Lake. Cold air will then return through the day Sunday, returning snow levels to near sea level and refreezing water on area roadways.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
